consent:
Informed Consent to Participate in Research

 

Study title: Digital Media Use Behaviors

Researchers: Kai Lukoff, Assistant Professor, Computer Science and Engineering, Santa Clara University

 

We’re inviting you to take a survey for research. This survey is completely voluntary. There are no negative consequences if you don’t want to take it. If you start the survey, you can always change your mind and stop at any time.

 

What is the purpose of this study? 

We are conducting a research study to understand when and why digital media use sometimes conflicts with people’s goals.

 

What will I do? 

This survey will ask questions about the apps and websites that you use. It includes questions about your goals for use, temptations that distract from your goals, and any strategies you use to manage your screen time. The survey will take about 20 minutes.  

 

Risks:

The following are risks of the study:


 Some questions ask about digital media use that conflicts with your goals. For example, overusing social media. Answering these questions may lead to feelings of dissatisfaction or regret. You can skip these questions or quit the survey at any time.
 Online data being hacked or intercepted: Anytime you share information online there are risks. We’re using a secure system to collect this data, but we can’t completely eliminate this risk.
 Breach of confidentiality: There is a chance your data could be seen by someone who shouldn’t have access to it. We’re minimizing this risk in the following ways:
 
  Data is de-identified, we do not collect your name or any personally identifying information.
  We’ll store all electronic data on a password-protected, encrypted computer. 
 
 




 
Possible benefits: 

The information gained from the study will help inform the design of interventions and technologies, such as screen time tools, that help people manage their digital media use.

 
How long will it take? 

About 20 minutes.

 
Future research: 

De-identified data (all identifying information removed) may be shared with other researchers. You won’t be told specific details about these future research studies.

 

Who can see my data?


 We (the researchers) will have access to your responses to the survey questions. This is so we can analyze the data and conduct the study.
 We may share our findings in publications or presentations. If we do, the results will be de-identified (no names, birthdate, address, etc.).
 We may make our dataset public so other researchers can use it. This public dataset will include only de-identified (no names, birthdate, address, etc.)


 
Questions about the research, complaints, or problems: 

Contact Kai Lukoff, Assistant Professor at Santa Clara University, at 408-551-3923

 
Questions about your rights as a research participant, complaints, or problems: 

Chair of the Human Subjects Committee at Santa Clara University, through the Office of Research Compliance and Integrity at (408) 554-5591

 

Agreement to Participate

Your participation is completely voluntary, and you can withdraw at any time.


 

To take this survey, you must be:

 At least 18 years old
 Reside in the United States


 

I have read this form, been given the chance to ask questions and have my questions answered. If I have more questions, I have been told who to contact. By selecting “I Agree” below, I am providing my signature by electronic means and agree to be in this study. I can print or save a copy of this consent information for future reference. If I do not want to be in this study, I can select “I Do Not Agree” to exit out of the survey.

media_use_weekdays_1: For an average weekday, please indicate for each purpose how many hours per day you spend on digital media. - For work purposes
media_use_weekdays_2: For an average weekday, please indicate for each purpose how many hours per day you spend on digital media. - For private and leisure purposes
media_use_weekends_1: For an average weekend day, please indicate for each purpose how many hours per day you spend on digital media. - For work purposes
media_use_weekends_2: For an average weekend day, please indicate for each purpose how many hours per day you spend on digital media. - For private and leisure purposes
quality_check_b_1: For quality purposes, please indicate '0 hrs' for work purposes and '10+ hrs' for private and leisure purposes. - For work purposes
quality_check_b_2: For quality purposes, please indicate '0 hrs' for work purposes and '10+ hrs' for private and leisure purposes. - For private and leisure purposes
desire_to_disconnect:
Some people feel they use digital media too much and ideally would use it less. Other people are happy with their usage or would ideally use it more.

In general, how do you feel about your use of digital media?
limiting_practices:
People sometimes deliberately limit their use of digital media. Some examples are putting digital devices away during other activities, turning off notifications from apps and programs, or closing apps and programs that take too much time. 

To what extent do you deliberately limit your use of digital media?
difficulty_to_limit: Do you find it easy or difficult to limit your use of digital media?
quality_check_c: In order to show that you are paying attention, please select 'Does not apply to me.'
social_norms_1: To what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements? - I find it important to limit my digital media use
social_norms_2: To what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements? - My family and friends find it important to limit their digital media use
why_disconnect_1:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I want to spend less time on digital media
why_disconnect_2:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I sometimes do not want to be digitally available to others
why_disconnect_3:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I consider it important for my well-being
why_disconnect_4:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I do not want to be distracted during a leisure activity
why_disconnect_5:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I do not want to be distracted when I am working
why_disconnect_6:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I am concerned about my online privacy
why_disconnect_7:
We are interested in why people limit their digital media use. To what extent do the following statements apply to you? 


I limit my digital media use because.... - I am not interested in certain content on digital media
